---
title: "Assignment 5"
subtitle: "Hockey stuff"

format: html
categories: [Assignment, DataViz]

code-fold: true
code-tools: true
descrption: "Hockey data stuff"
---



# OVERVIEW

Here are my selections for the hockey trophies listed and described below in each section.

For each award, I have created a ballot of five players, ranked from 1 (first choice) to 5 (fifth choice).  For each ballot, I have provided one to three visualizations that explain and justify your ballot.

# THE DATA

At minimum, we will use the data from naturalstattrick.com for player statistics for the season to date (Oct 2024 to March 2025).  You can find the Data Dictionary [here](DataDictionary.qmd)





::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
Individual.Skater <- read.csv("SkaterIndividualstats.csv")
OnIce.Skater <- read.csv("SkaterOnicestats.csv")
Goalie <- read.csv("Goalies.csv")
Individual.Skater.Rookie <- read.csv("RookieSkaterindividual.csv")
OnIce.Skater.Rookie <- read.csv("RookieSkaterOnIce.csv")
Rookie.Goalie <- read.csv("RookieGoalies.csv")
```
:::




# Vezina Trophy
Presented to the goaltender "adjudged to be the best at this position." NHL general managers vote on this award.




::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
goalie_m1 <- lm(Saves~GP, data=Goalie)
```
:::



The red line on the graph shows where an approximate cut-off point could be. We want the players above the line. 



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(data=Goalie, aes(x=GP, y=Saves))+
  geom_point()+
  theme_bw()+
  geom_abline(aes(intercept=goalie_m1$coefficients["(Intercept)"],
                  slope=goalie_m1$coefficients["GP"]))+
  geom_hline(yintercept=1100, color="red")+
  labs(x="Games Played",
       y="Saves made by the goalie",
       caption = "source: https://www.naturalstattrick.com/",
       title="Saves Made per Games Played",
       subtitle = "2024-2025 season stats as of March 4")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](index_files/figure-html/Saves made per games played-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
goalie_m2 <- lm(Saves~Shots.Against, data=Goalie)
```
:::



The red line on the graph shows where an approximate cut-off point could be. We want the players above the line.



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(data=Goalie, aes(x=Shots.Against, y=Saves))+
  geom_point()+
  theme_bw()+
  geom_abline(aes(intercept=goalie_m2$coefficients["(Intercept)"],
                  slope=goalie_m2$coefficients["Shots.Against"]))+
  geom_hline(yintercept=1100, color="red")+
  labs(x="Shots Against",
       y="Saves made by the goalie",
       caption = "source: https://www.naturalstattrick.com/",
       title="Saves Made per shots against",
       subtitle = "2024-2025 season stats as of March 4")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](index_files/figure-html/Saves made per shots against-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
goalie_m3 <- lm(SV.~GP, data=Goalie)
goalie_m3$coefficients["(Intercept)"]
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
(Intercept) 
  0.8749336 
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
goalie_m3$coefficients["GP"]
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
          GP 
0.0008209681 
```


:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
plot(goalie_m3)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](index_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-3-1.png){width=672}
:::

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](index_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-3-2.png){width=672}
:::

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](index_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-3-3.png){width=672}
:::

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](index_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-3-4.png){width=672}
:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(data=Goalie, aes(x=GP, y=SV.))+
  geom_point()+
  theme_bw()+
  geom_abline(aes(intercept=goalie_m3$coefficients["(Intercept)"],
                  slope=goalie_m3$coefficients["GP"]))+
  #geom_hline(yintercept=1100, color="red")+
  labs(x="Games Played",
       y="% Shots against that were saves",
       caption = "source: https://www.naturalstattrick.com/",
       title="% Saves Made per Games Played",
       subtitle = "2024-2025 season stats as of March 4")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](index_files/figure-html/percent Save per Games Played-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::



I want to see who are the top 5 in GP, Saves, and SV.
Top 5 in GP:

```{.r .cell-code}
Goalie |> select(Player, GP, Shots.Against, Saves, SV.) |>
  arrange(desc(GP)) |>
  slice_head(n=5)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```

1 Andrei Vasilevskiy 48          1335  1232 0.923
2  Connor Hellebuyck 46          1262  1170 0.927
3   Sam Montembeault 46          1232  1108 0.899
4       Ilya Sorokin 45          1237  1117 0.903
5        Juuse Saros 45          1252  1124 0.898
```


:::
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
Goalie |> select(Player, GP, Shots.Against, Saves, SV.) |>
  arrange(desc(Saves)) |>
  slice_head(n=5)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
               Player GP Shots.Against Saves   SV.
1  Andrei Vasilevskiy 48          1335  1232 0.923
2   Connor Hellebuyck 46          1262  1170 0.927
```

```{.r .cell-code}
Goalie |> select(Player, GP, Shots.Against, Saves, SV.) |>
  arrange(desc(SV.)) |>
  slice_head(n=5)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}


:::
:::



## Vezina ballot

Once the data is filtered by > 40 games played and > 1100 saves, it seems like the best discerning feature would be % Saves (if I understand the data correctly). Once those are all sorted out, the top 5 players below will be on my Vezina Trophy ballot.

The vezina ballot:



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
Vezina_ballot <- Goalie |> select(Player, GP, Shots.Against, Saves, SV.) |>
  filter(GP > 40) |>
  filter(Saves > 1100) |>
  arrange(desc(SV.)) |>
  mutate(Rank=row_number()) |>
  slice_head(n=5)
  
Vezina_ballot
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
               Player GP Shots.Against Saves   SV. Rank
1   Connor Hellebuyck 46          1262  1170 0.927    1
2  Andrei Vasilevskiy 48          1335  1232 0.923    2
3 Mackenzie Blackwood 44          1229  1125 0.915    3
4     Igor Shesterkin 44          1263  1144 0.906    4
5        Ilya Sorokin 45          1237  1117 0.903    5
```


:::
:::



# Hart Memorial Trophy

Awarded to the "player judged most valuable to his team." This isn't necessarily the best overall player, but rather the one who contributes most significantly to his team's success.

It seems like lots of games played plus lots of goals made would be a nice place to start. People towards the top right of the graph below should be taken into consideration for significant contribution.



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(Individual.Skater, aes(x=GP, y=Goals))+
  geom_point()+
  theme_bw()+
  labs(x="Games Played",
       y="Goals made",
       caption = "source: https://www.naturalstattrick.com/",
       title="Goals versus Games Played",
       subtitle = "2024-2025 season stats as of March 4")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](index_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-4-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::



That being said, not just the folks making the goals should be considered. Defense should be considered. One way to assess this might be with the OnIce.Skater data, using the GF statistics (count of goals for that player's team while that player is on the ice).

I'm sorting the top 20 so it can be visualized.



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
hartmemorial <- OnIce.Skater |> select(Player, GF, GP) |>
  arrange(desc(GF)) |>
  slice_head(n=20)

hartmemorial
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
             Player  GF GP
1  Nathan MacKinnon 116 61
2    Leon Draisaitl 109 60
3   Nikita Kucherov 109 57
4        Cale Makar 109 61
5       Jack Eichel 106 59
6     Brandon Hagel 105 60
7    Mikko Rantanen 103 60
8       Jack Hughes 102 62
9    Mark Scheifele 102 61
10    Evan Bouchard 101 60
11      Kyle Connor 101 61
12    Zach Werenski  99 59
13     Mitch Marner  99 60
14     John Carlson  98 61
15  Dougie Hamilton  97 62
16    Jake Guentzel  97 59
17    Brayden Point  96 55
18   Josh Morrissey  96 60
19   Connor McDavid  95 54
20     Martin Necas  94 61
```


:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(hartmemorial, aes(x=GF, y=reorder(Player, GF)))+
  geom_bar(stat="identity")+
  theme_bw()
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](index_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-6-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


Now I want to see a scatter plot with names in it.

When looking at this graph, the best contendors will be located in the top right.



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(hartmemorial, aes(x=GP, y=GF))+
  geom_point()+
  theme_bw()+
  geom_text(aes(label=Player), hjust=0.5, vjust=-0.5, size=2)+
  labs(title = "20 Contenders for the Hart Memorial Award",
       x="Number of games played",
       y="Count of goals while player is on ice",
       caption = "source: https://www.naturalstattrick.com/",
       subtitle = "2024-2025 season stats as of March 4")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](index_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-7-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::



## Hart Memorial ballot

After consideration, it seems to me that there is not an appreciable difference between playing 54 and 62 games, so that will not be considered. The only factor I will consider needed is GF, because this already sorts out players who have only played a small number of games. Therefore I will take the top 5 in the GF category:

The hart memorial ballot:



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
hartmemorial_ballot <- OnIce.Skater |> select(Player, GF, GP) |>
  arrange(desc(GF)) |>
  slice_head(n=5) |>
  mutate(Rank=row_number())

hartmemorial_ballot
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
            Player  GF GP Rank
1 Nathan MacKinnon 116 61    1
2   Leon Draisaitl 109 60    2
3  Nikita Kucherov 109 57    3
4       Cale Makar 109 61    4
5      Jack Eichel 106 59    5
```


:::
:::



# James Norris Memorial Trophy

Awarded to the defenseman who demonstrates "the greatest all-around ability" at the position.

I will look at Scoring Chance- SCF, count of scoring chances for that player's team while that player is on the ice. I will also look at shots blocked.



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
OnIce.Skater |> select(Player, Team, GP, SCF) |>
  arrange(desc(SCF)) |>
  slice_head(n=20) -> top_SCF

top_SCF
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
             Player     Team GP  SCF
1  Nathan MacKinnon      COL 61 1003
2        Cale Makar      COL 61  943
3       Jack Hughes      N.J 62  922
4     Evan Bouchard      EDM 60  916
5    Mikko Rantanen CAR, COL 60  897
6    Leon Draisaitl      EDM 60  871
7   Dougie Hamilton      N.J 62  832
8     Erik Karlsson      PIT 63  831
9          Adam Fox      NYR 58  811
10    Zach Werenski      CBJ 59  811
11   Connor McDavid      EDM 54  801
12     Jesper Bratt      N.J 62  790
13       Roman Josi      NSH 53  784
14     John Carlson      WSH 61  777
15  Nikita Kucherov      T.B 57  775
16    Sebastian Aho      CAR 60  771
17    Sidney Crosby      PIT 61  768
18 Carter Verhaeghe      FLA 62  765
19     Sam Reinhart      FLA 62  763
20     Mitch Marner      TOR 60  759
```


:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
Individual.Skater |> select(Player, Team, GP, Shots.Blocked) |>
  arrange(desc(Shots.Blocked)) |>
  slice_head(n=15) -> top_shotsblocked

top_shotsblocked
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
             Player     Team GP Shots.Blocked
1          Ian Cole      UTA 61           160
2      Jacob Trouba ANA, NYR 58           158
3       Chris Tanev      TOR 57           151
4  Rasmus Andersson      CGY 60           147
5       Nick Seeler      PHI 56           142
6    Colton Parayko      STL 61           137
7     Moritz Seider      DET 60           135
8  MacKenzie Weegar      CGY 60           134
9      David Savard      MTL 55           134
10   Travis Sanheim      PHI 61           133
11      Radko Gudas      ANA 58           132
12      Esa Lindell      DAL 60           131
13   Jake Sanderson      OTT 59           129
14   Brayden McNabb      VGK 60           129
15   Jake Middleton      MIN 50           122
```


:::
:::



Ok, based on this code, there is no overlap between top SCF and top shots blocked.



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
top_shotsblocked$Player %in% top_SCF$Player
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
 [1] FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE
[13] FALSE FALSE FALSE
```


:::
:::


So I guess I will choose top shots blocked.

I put team in color here. I wondered if we would see clusters by team. But there is nearly no overlap, so it actually looks worse:



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(data=top_shotsblocked, aes(x=GP, y=Shots.Blocked, color=Team))+
  geom_point()+
  theme_bw()+
  geom_text(aes(label=Player), hjust=0.5, vjust=-0.5, size=2)+
  labs(title = "20 Contenders for the James Norris Award, with Teams in color",
       x="Number of games played",
       y="Shots Blocked",
       caption = "source: https://www.naturalstattrick.com/",
       subtitle = "2024-2025 season stats as of March 4")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](index_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-11-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::



This is better (no color)



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(data=top_shotsblocked, aes(x=GP, y=Shots.Blocked))+
  geom_point()+
  theme_bw()+
  geom_text(aes(label=Player), hjust=0.5, vjust=-0.5, size=2)+
  labs(title = "20 Contenders for the James Norris Award",
       x="Number of games played",
       y="Shots Blocked",
       caption = "source: https://www.naturalstattrick.com/",
       subtitle = "2024-2025 season stats as of March 4")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](index_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-12-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::



## James Norris ballot

Here is the James Norris ballot:



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
James_norris_ballot <- top_shotsblocked |> slice_head(n=5) |>
  mutate(Rank=row_number())

James_norris_ballot
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
            Player     Team GP Shots.Blocked Rank
1         Ian Cole      UTA 61           160    1
2     Jacob Trouba ANA, NYR 58           158    2
3      Chris Tanev      TOR 57           151    3
4 Rasmus Andersson      CGY 60           147    4
5      Nick Seeler      PHI 56           142    5
```


:::
:::



# Calder Memorial Trophy

Given to the player "adjudged to be the most proficient in his first year of competition." This is essentially the rookie of the year award.



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
Individual.Skater.Rookie |> select(Player, GP, Goals, Shots.Blocked) |>
  arrange(desc(Goals)) -> caldermemorial

head(caldermemorial)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
            Player GP Goals Shots.Blocked
1 Kirill Marchenko 57    24            29
2    Matthew Knies 57    24            31
3  Pavel Dorofeyev 60    24            30
4   Wyatt Johnston 60    21            30
5      Marco Rossi 61    21            28
6   Dylan Holloway 62    20            39
```


:::
:::



For fun, let's look at Goals versus Shots.Blocked.



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(data=caldermemorial, aes(x=Goals, y=Shots.Blocked))+
  geom_point()+
  theme_bw()+
  #geom_text(aes(label=Player), hjust=0.5, vjust=-0.5, size=2)+
  labs(title = "Shots Blocked versus Goals for Calder Memorial assessment",
       x="Individual Goals",
       y="Shots Blocked",
       caption = "source: https://www.naturalstattrick.com/",
       subtitle = "2024-2025 season stats as of March 4")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](index_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-15-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


Now we will take a look at games played and GF, count of goals for that player's team while that player is on the ice.



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
OnIce.Skater.Rookie|> select(Player, GP, GF) |>
  arrange(desc(GF)) -> caldermemorial2

head(caldermemorial2)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
            Player GP GF
1 Kirill Marchenko 57 93
2       JJ Peterka 57 85
3   Wyatt Johnston 60 81
4      Marco Rossi 61 73
5    Matthew Knies 57 71
6      Brock Faber 57 71
```


:::
:::



Now let's get the top 10 from both of those data sets and see who overlaps.



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
caldermemorial <- caldermemorial |> slice_head(n=10) |> arrange(Player)

caldermemorial2 <- caldermemorial2 |> slice_head(n=10) |> arrange(Player)

calder_overlap <- caldermemorial |>
  inner_join(caldermemorial2, by="Player") |>
  select(Player) |>
  distinct()
```
:::



Here are the ones that overlap between my two categories:



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
calder_overlap
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
            Player
1       JJ Peterka
2 Kirill Marchenko
3     Logan Cooley
4      Marco Rossi
5    Matthew Knies
6   Wyatt Johnston
```


:::
:::



## Calder memorial ballot:

Since these have already been sorted above, I'm going to grab the top 5 for my ballot:



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
calder_overlap |> mutate(Rank=row_number()) |> slice_head(n=5) -> calder_memorial_ballot

calder_memorial_ballot
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
            Player Rank
1       JJ Peterka    1
2 Kirill Marchenko    2
3     Logan Cooley    3
4      Marco Rossi    4
5    Matthew Knies    5
```


:::
:::



# Frank J. Selke Trophy
Awarded to the forward who best excels in the defensive aspects of the game.

AI tells me that in hockey, a forward is a player whose primary role is to score goals and create offensive plays. They can be center, left wing, or right wing. I am going to assume that these correspond to Position C, L, and R.

I don't understand the difference between this and the James Norris trophy, other than I need to sort by Position =C, L, or R. So I will use top shots blocked because that's what I ended up with before.



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
Individual.Skater |> select(Player, Position, GP, Shots.Blocked) |>
  filter(Position %in% c("C","L","R"))|>
  arrange(desc(Shots.Blocked)) |>
  slice_head(n=20) |>
  mutate(LastName = sub(".*\\s", "", Player)) -> frank_contendors

frank_contendors
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
               Player Position GP Shots.Blocked   LastName
1       Brandon Tanev        L 59            91      Tanev
2           Alex Tuch        R 59            87       Tuch
3        Noel Acciari        C 63            73    Acciari
4      Rickard Rakell        R 62            66     Rakell
5    Vincent Trocheck        C 61            66   Trocheck
6     Mathieu Olivier        R 60            66    Olivier
7            Nic Dowd        C 61            65       Dowd
8          Luke Kunin        C 62            64      Kunin
9    Elias Pettersson        C 54            63 Pettersson
10     Elias Lindholm        C 62            63   Lindholm
11     Colton Sissons        C 59            62    Sissons
12  Fabian Zetterlund        L 62            61 Zetterlund
13    Auston Matthews        C 46            59   Matthews
14    Phillip Danault        C 58            57    Danault
15      Adam Henrique        C 59            57   Henrique
16    Garnet Hathaway        R 60            56   Hathaway
17 Alexander Wennberg        C 57            55   Wennberg
18   Christian Dvorak        C 61            54     Dvorak
19         Tom Wilson        R 60            53     Wilson
20    Anthony Cirelli        C 58            53    Cirelli
```


:::
:::



Now I want to visualize this. I wondered if adding Position by color would be interesting. In addition I did last name only so that the plot was less busy.



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(data=frank_contendors, aes(x=GP, y=Shots.Blocked, color=Position))+
  geom_point()+
  theme_bw()+
  geom_text(aes(label=LastName), hjust=0.5, vjust=-0.5, size=2)+
  labs(title = "20 Contenders for the Frank J. Selke Trophy",
       x="Number of games played",
       y="Shots Blocked",
       caption = "source: https://www.naturalstattrick.com/",
       subtitle = "2024-2025 season stats as of March 4")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](index_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-21-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


In the end, I will use top shots blocked.

## Frank J. Selke Trophy ballot



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
frank_ballot <- frank_contendors |> slice_head(n=5) |>
  select(-c("LastName")) |> mutate(Rank=row_number())
  

frank_ballot
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
            Player Position GP Shots.Blocked Rank
1    Brandon Tanev        L 59            91    1
2        Alex Tuch        R 59            87    2
3     Noel Acciari        C 63            73    3
4   Rickard Rakell        R 62            66    4
5 Vincent Trocheck        C 61            66    5
```


:::
:::






# Lady Byng Memorial Trophy
Presented to the player who exhibits "the best type of sportsmanship and gentlemanly conduct combined with a high standard of playing ability."
